text: Ought you not to know that Yahweh, the God of Israel, gave the kingdom over Israel to David forever, even to him and to his sons by a covenant of salt?

name: 2 Chronicles 13:6
text: Yet Jeroboam the son of Nebat, the servant of Solomon the son of David, rose up, and rebelled against his lord.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:7
text: There were gathered to him worthless men, base fellows, who strengthened themselves against Rehoboam the son of Solomon, when Rehoboam was young and tenderhearted, and could not withstand them.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:8
text: "Now you think to withstand the kingdom of Yahweh in the hand of the sons of David; and you are a great multitude, and there are with you the golden calves which Jeroboam made you for gods.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:9
text: Haven"t you driven out the priests of Yahweh, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites, and made priests for yourselves after the ways of the peoples of other lands? so that whoever comes to consecrate himself with a young bull and seven rams, the same may be a priest of those who are no gods.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:10
text: "But as for us, Yahweh is our God, and we have not forsaken him; and we have priests ministering to Yahweh, the sons of Aaron, and the Levites in their work:

name: 2 Chronicles 13:11
text: and they burn to Yahweh every morning and every evening burnt offerings and sweet incense. They also set the show bread in order on the pure table; and the lampstand of gold with its lamps, to burn every evening: for we keep the instruction of Yahweh our God; but you have forsaken him.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:12
text: Behold, God is with us at our head, and his priests with the trumpets of alarm to sound an alarm against you. Children of Israel, don"t fight against Yahweh, the God of your fathers; for you shall not prosper."

name: 2 Chronicles 13:13
text: But Jeroboam caused an ambush to come about behind them: so they were before Judah, and the ambush was behind them.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:14
text: When Judah looked back, behold, the battle was before and behind them; and they cried to Yahweh, and the priests sounded with the trumpets.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:15
text: Then the men of Judah gave a shout: and as the men of Judah shouted, it happened, that God struck Jeroboam and all Israel before Abijah and Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:16
text: The children of Israel fled before Judah; and God delivered them into their hand.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:17
text: Abijah and his people killed them with a great slaughter: so there fell down slain of Israel five hundred thousand chosen men.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:18
text: Thus the children of Israel were brought under at that time, and the children of Judah prevailed, because they relied on Yahweh, the God of their fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:19
text: Abijah pursued after Jeroboam, and took cities from him, Bethel with its towns, and Jeshanah with its towns, and Ephron with its towns.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:20
text: Jeroboam didn"t recover strength again in the days of Abijah. Yahweh struck him, and he died.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:21
text: But Abijah grew mighty, and took to himself fourteen wives, and became the father of twenty-two sons, and sixteen daughters.

name: 2 Chronicles 13:22
text: The rest of the acts of Abijah, and his ways, and his sayings, are written in the commentary of the prophet Iddo.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:1
text: So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David; and Asa his son reigned in his place. In his days the land was quiet ten years.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:2
text: Asa did that which was good and right in the eyes of Yahweh his God:

name: 2 Chronicles 14:3
text: for he took away the foreign altars, and the high places, and broke down the pillars, and cut down the Asherim,

name: 2 Chronicles 14:4
text: and commanded Judah to seek Yahweh, the God of their fathers, and to do the law and the commandment.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:5
text: Also he took away out of all the cities of Judah the high places and the sun images: and the kingdom was quiet before him.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:6
text: He built fortified cities in Judah; for the land was quiet, and he had no war in those years, because Yahweh had given him rest.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:7
text: For he said to Judah, "Let us build these cities, and make walls around them, with towers, gates, and bars. The land is yet before us, because we have sought Yahweh our God; we have sought him, and he has given us rest on every side." So they built and prospered.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:8
text: Asa had an army that bore bucklers and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bore shields and drew bows, two hundred eighty thousand: all these were mighty men of valor.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:9
text: There came out against them Zerah the Ethiopian with an army of a million troops, and three hundred chariots; and he came to Mareshah.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:10
text: Then Asa went out to meet him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:11
text: Asa cried to Yahweh his God, and said, "Yahweh, there is none besides you to help, between the mighty and him who has no strength. Help us, Yahweh our God; for we rely on you, and in your name are we come against this multitude. Yahweh, you are our God. Don"t let man prevail against you."

name: 2 Chronicles 14:12
text: So Yahweh struck the Ethiopians before Asa, and before Judah; and the Ethiopians fled.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:13
text: Asa and the people who were with him pursued them to Gerar: and there fell of the Ethiopians so many that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before Yahweh, and before his army; and they carried away very much booty.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:14
text: They struck all the cities around Gerar; for the fear of Yahweh came on them: and they despoiled all the cities; for there was much spoil in them.

name: 2 Chronicles 14:15
text: They struck also the tents of livestock, and carried away sheep in abundance, and camels, and returned to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:1
text: The Spirit of God came on Azariah the son of Oded:

name: 2 Chronicles 15:2
text: and he went out to meet Asa, and said to him, "Hear me, Asa, and all Judah and Benjamin! Yahweh is with you, while you are with him; and if you seek him, he will be found by you; but if you forsake him, he will forsake you.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:3
text: Now for a long time Israel was without the true God, and without a teaching priest, and without law.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:4
text: But when in their distress they turned to Yahweh, the God of Israel, and sought him, he was found by them.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:5
text: In those times there was no peace to him who went out, nor to him who came in; but great troubles were on all the inhabitants of the lands.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:6
text: They were broken in pieces, nation against nation, and city against city; for God troubled them with all adversity.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:7
text: But you be strong, and don"t let your hands be slack; for your work shall be rewarded."

name: 2 Chronicles 15:8
text: When Asa heard these words, and the prophecy of Oded the prophet, he took courage, and put away the abominations out of all the land of Judah and Benjamin, and out of the cities which he had taken from the hill country of Ephraim; and he renewed the altar of Yahweh, that was before the porch of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:9
text: He gathered all Judah and Benjamin, and those who lived with them out of Ephraim and Manasseh, and out of Simeon: for they fell to him out of Israel in abundance, when they saw that Yahweh his God was with him.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:10
text: So they gathered themselves together at Jerusalem in the third month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of Asa.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:11
text: They sacrificed to Yahweh in that day, of the spoil which they had brought, seven hundred head of cattle and seven thousand sheep.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:12
text: They entered into the covenant to seek Yahweh, the God of their fathers, with all their heart and with all their soul;

name: 2 Chronicles 15:13
text: and that whoever would not seek Yahweh, the God of Israel, should be put to death, whether small or great, whether man or woman.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:14
text: They swore to Yahweh with a loud voice, and with shouting, and with trumpets, and with cornets.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:15
text: All Judah rejoiced at the oath; for they had sworn with all their heart, and sought him with their whole desire; and he was found of them: and Yahweh gave them rest all around.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:16
text: Also Maacah, the mother of Asa the king, he removed from being queen, because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah; and Asa cut down her image, and made dust of it, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:17
text: But the high places were not taken away out of Israel: nevertheless the heart of Asa was perfect all his days.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:18
text: He brought into the house of God the things that his father had dedicated, and that he himself had dedicated, silver, and gold, and vessels.

name: 2 Chronicles 15:19
text: There was no more war to the five and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:1
text: In the six and thirtieth year of the reign of Asa, Baasha king of Israel went up against Judah, and built Ramah, that he might not allow anyone to go out or come in to Asa king of Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:2
text: Then Asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasures of the house of Yahweh and of the king"s house, and sent to Ben Hadad king of Syria, who lived at Damascus, saying,

name: 2 Chronicles 16:3
text: "Let there be a treaty between me and you, as there was between my father and your father. Behold, I have sent you silver and gold. Go, break your treaty with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me."

name: 2 Chronicles 16:4
text: Ben Hadad listened to king Asa, and sent the captains of his armies against the cities of Israel; and they struck Ijon, and Dan, and Abel Maim, and all the storage cities of Naphtali.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:5
text: It happened, when Baasha heard of it, that he left off building Ramah, and let his work cease.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:6
text: Then Asa the king took all Judah; and they carried away the stones of Ramah, and its timber, with which Baasha had built; and he built therewith Geba and Mizpah.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:7
text: At that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah, and said to him, "Because you have relied on the king of Syria, and have not relied on Yahweh your God, therefore is the army of the king of Syria escaped out of your hand.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:8
text: Weren"t the Ethiopians and the Lubim a huge army, with chariots and horsemen exceeding many? Yet, because you relied on Yahweh, he delivered them into your hand.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:9
text: For the eyes of Yahweh run back and forth throughout the whole earth, to show himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward him. Herein you have done foolishly; for from henceforth you shall have wars."

name: 2 Chronicles 16:10
text: Then Asa was angry with the seer, and put him in the prison; for he was in a rage with him because of this thing. Asa oppressed some of the people at the same time.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:11
text: Behold, the acts of Asa, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:12
text: In the thirty-ninth year of his reign Asa was diseased in his feet; his disease was exceeding great: yet in his disease he didn"t seek Yahweh, but to the physicians.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:13
text: Asa slept with his fathers, and died in the one and fortieth year of his reign.

name: 2 Chronicles 16:14
text: They buried him in his own tombs, which he had dug out for himself in the city of David, and laid him in the bed which was filled with sweet odors and various kinds of spices prepared by the perfumers" art: and they made a very great burning for him.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:1
text: Jehoshaphat his son reigned in his place, and strengthened himself against Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:2
text: He placed forces in all the fortified cities of Judah, and set garrisons in the land of Judah, and in the cities of Ephraim, which Asa his father had taken.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:3
text: Yahweh was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the first ways of his father David, and didn"t seek the Baals,

name: 2 Chronicles 17:4
text: but sought to the God of his father, and walked in his commandments, and not after the doings of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:5
text: Therefore Yahweh established the kingdom in his hand; and all Judah brought to Jehoshaphat tribute; and he had riches and honor in abundance.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:6
text: His heart was lifted up in the ways of Yahweh: and furthermore he took away the high places and the Asherim out of Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:7
text: Also in the third year of his reign he sent his princes, even Ben Hail, and Obadiah, and Zechariah, and Nethanel, and Micaiah, to teach in the cities of Judah;

name: 2 Chronicles 17:8
text: and with them the Levites, even Shemaiah, and Nethaniah, and Zebadiah, and Asahel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehonathan, and Adonijah, and Tobijah, and Tobadonijah, the Levites; and with them Elishama and Jehoram, the priests.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:9
text: They taught in Judah, having the book of the law of Yahweh with them; and they went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught among the people.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:10
text: The fear of Yahweh fell on all the kingdoms of the lands that were around Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:11
text: Some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents, and silver for tribute; the Arabians also brought him flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams, and seven thousand and seven hundred male goats.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:12
text: Jehoshaphat grew great exceedingly; and he built in Judah castles and cities of store.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:13
text: He had many works in the cities of Judah; and men of war, mighty men of valor, in Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:14
text: This was the numbering of them according to their fathers" houses: Of Judah, the captains of thousands: Adnah the captain, and with him mighty men of valor three hundred thousand;

name: 2 Chronicles 17:15
text: and next to him Jehohanan the captain, and with him two hundred eighty thousand;

name: 2 Chronicles 17:16
text: and next to him Amasiah the son of Zichri, who willingly offered himself to Yahweh; and with him two hundred thousand mighty men of valor.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:17
text: Of Benjamin: Eliada a mighty man of valor, and with him two hundred thousand armed with bow and shield;

name: 2 Chronicles 17:18
text: and next to him Jehozabad and with him one hundred eighty thousand ready prepared for war.

name: 2 Chronicles 17:19
text: These were those who waited on the king, besides those whom the king put in the fortified cities throughout all Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:1
text: Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honor in abundance; and he joined affinity with Ahab.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:2
text: After certain years he went down to Ahab to Samaria. Ahab killed sheep and cattle for him in abundance, and for the people who were with him, and moved him to go up with him to Ramoth Gilead.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:3
text: Ahab king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat king of Judah, "Will you go with me to Ramoth Gilead?" He answered him, "I am as you are, and my people as your people. We will be with you in the war."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:4
text: Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, "Please inquire first for the word of Yahweh."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:5
text: Then the king of Israel gathered the prophets together, four hundred men, and said to them, "Shall we go to Ramoth Gilead to battle, or shall I forbear?" They said, "Go up; for God will deliver it into the hand of the king."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:6
text: But Jehoshaphat said, "Isn"t there here a prophet of Yahweh besides, that we may inquire of him?"

name: 2 Chronicles 18:7
text: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "There is yet one man by whom we may inquire of Yahweh; but I hate him, for he never prophesies good concerning me, but always evil. He is Micaiah the son of Imla." Jehoshaphat said, "Don"t let the king say so."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:8
text: Then the king of Israel called an officer, and said, "Get Micaiah the son of Imla quickly."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:9
text: Now the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah sat each on his throne, arrayed in their robes, and they were sitting in an open place at the entrance of the gate of Samaria; and all the prophets were prophesying before them.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:10
text: Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah made him horns of iron, and said, "Thus says Yahweh, "With these you shall push the Syrians, until they are consumed.""

name: 2 Chronicles 18:11
text: All the prophets prophesied so, saying, "Go up to Ramoth Gilead, and prosper; for Yahweh will deliver it into the hand of the king."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:12
text: The messenger who went to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, "Behold, the words of the prophets declare good to the king with one mouth. Let your word therefore, please be like one of theirs, and speak good."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:13
text: Micaiah said, "As Yahweh lives, what my God says, that will I speak."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:14
text: When he had come to the king, the king said to him, "Micaiah, shall we go to Ramoth Gilead to battle, or shall I forbear?" He said, "Go up, and prosper. They shall be delivered into your hand."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:15
text: The king said to him, "How many times shall I adjure you that you speak to me nothing but the truth in the name of Yahweh?"

name: 2 Chronicles 18:16
text: He said, "I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd. Yahweh said, "These have no master. Let them return every man to his house in peace.""

name: 2 Chronicles 18:17
text: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "Didn"t I tell you that he would not prophesy good concerning me, but evil?"

name: 2 Chronicles 18:18
text: Micaiah said, "Therefore hear the word of Yahweh: I saw Yahweh sitting on his throne, and all the army of heaven standing on his right hand and on his left.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:19
text: Yahweh said, "Who shall entice Ahab king of Israel, that he may go up and fall at Ramoth Gilead?" One spoke saying in this way, and another saying in that way.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:20
text: A spirit came out, stood before Yahweh, and said, "I will entice him." "Yahweh said to him, "How?"

name: 2 Chronicles 18:21
text: "He said, "I will go forth, and will be a lying spirit in the mouth of all his prophets." "He said, "You will entice him, and will prevail also. Go forth, and do so."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:22
text: "Now therefore, behold, Yahweh has put a lying spirit in the mouth of these your prophets; and Yahweh has spoken evil concerning you."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:23
text: Then Zedekiah the son of Chenaanah came near, and struck Micaiah on the cheek, and said, "Which way did the Spirit of Yahweh go from me to speak to you?"

name: 2 Chronicles 18:24
text: Micaiah said, "Behold, you shall see on that day, when you shall go into an inner room to hide yourself."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:25
text: The king of Israel said, "Take Micaiah, and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king"s son;

name: 2 Chronicles 18:26
text: and say, "Thus says the king, "Put this fellow in the prison, and feed him with bread of affliction and with water of affliction, until I return in peace."""

name: 2 Chronicles 18:27
text: Micaiah said, "If you return at all in peace, Yahweh has not spoken by me." He said, "Listen, you peoples, all of you!"

name: 2 Chronicles 18:28
text: So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat the king of Judah went up to Ramoth Gilead.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:29
text: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat, "I will disguise myself, and go into the battle; but you put on your robes." So the king of Israel disguised himself; and they went into the battle.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:30
text: Now the king of Syria had commanded the captains of his chariots, saying, "Fight neither with small nor great, except only with the king of Israel."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:31
text: It happened, when the captains of the chariots saw Jehoshaphat, that they said, "It is the king of Israel!" Therefore they turned around to fight against him. But Jehoshaphat cried out, and Yahweh helped him; and God moved them to depart from him.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:32
text: It happened, when the captains of the chariots saw that it was not the king of Israel, that they turned back from pursuing him.

name: 2 Chronicles 18:33
text: A certain man drew his bow at random, and struck the king of Israel between the joints of the armor. Therefore he said to the driver of the chariot, "Turn your hand, and carry me out of the army; for I am severely wounded."

name: 2 Chronicles 18:34
text: The battle increased that day. However the king of Israel propped himself up in his chariot against the Syrians until the evening; and about the time of the going down of the sun, he died.

name: 2 Chronicles 19:1
text: Jehoshaphat the king of Judah returned to his house in peace to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 19:2
text: Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him, and said to king Jehoshaphat, "Should you help the wicked, and love those who hate Yahweh? Because of this, wrath is on you from before Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 19:3
text: Nevertheless there are good things found in you, in that you have put away the Asheroth out of the land, and have set your heart to seek God."

name: 2 Chronicles 19:4
text: Jehoshaphat lived at Jerusalem: and he went out again among the people from Beersheba to the hill country of Ephraim, and brought them back to Yahweh, the God of their fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 19:5
text: He set judges in the land throughout all the fortified cities of Judah, city by city,

name: 2 Chronicles 19:6
text: and said to the judges, "Consider what you do: for you don"t judge for man, but for Yahweh; and he is with you in the judgment.

name: 2 Chronicles 19:7
text: Now therefore let the fear of Yahweh be on you. Take heed and do it: for there is no iniquity with Yahweh our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of bribes."

name: 2 Chronicles 19:8
text: Moreover in Jerusalem Jehoshaphat appointed Levites and priests, and of the heads of the fathers" households of Israel, for the judgment of Yahweh, and for controversies. They returned to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 19:9
text: He commanded them, saying, "Thus you shall do in the fear of Yahweh, faithfully, and with a perfect heart.

name: 2 Chronicles 19:10
text: Whenever any controversy shall come to you from your brothers who dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and ordinances, you shall warn them, that they not be guilty towards Yahweh, and so wrath come on you and on your brothers. Do this, and you shall not be guilty.

name: 2 Chronicles 19:11
text: Behold, Amariah the chief priest is over you in all matters of Yahweh; and Zebadiah the son of Ishmael, the ruler of the house of Judah, in all the king"s matters: also the Levites shall be officers before you. Deal courageously, and may Yahweh be with the good."

name: 2 Chronicles 20:1
text: It happened after this, that the children of Moab, and the children of Ammon, and with them some of the Ammonites, came against Jehoshaphat to battle.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:2
text: Then some came who told Jehoshaphat, saying, "A great multitude is coming against you from beyond the sea from Syria. Behold, they are in Hazazon Tamar" (that is, En Gedi).

name: 2 Chronicles 20:3
text: Jehoshaphat was alarmed, and set himself to seek to Yahweh. He proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:4
text: Judah gathered themselves together, to seek help from Yahweh. They came out of all the cities of Judah to seek Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:5
text: Jehoshaphat stood in the assembly of Judah and Jerusalem, in the house of Yahweh, before the new court;

name: 2 Chronicles 20:6
text: and he said, "Yahweh, the God of our fathers, aren"t you God in heaven? Aren"t you ruler over all the kingdoms of the nations? Power and might are in your hand, so that no one is able to withstand you.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:7
text: Didn"t you, our God, drive out the inhabitants of this land before your people Israel, and give it to the seed of Abraham your friend forever?

name: 2 Chronicles 20:8
text: They lived in it, and have built you a sanctuary in it for your name, saying,

name: 2 Chronicles 20:9
text: "If evil comes on us"the sword, judgment, pestilence, or famine"we will stand before this house, and before you, (for your name is in this house), and cry to you in our affliction, and you will hear and save."

name: 2 Chronicles 20:10
text: Now, behold, the children of Ammon and Moab and Mount Seir, whom you would not let Israel invade, when they came out of the land of Egypt, but they turned aside from them, and didn"t destroy them;

name: 2 Chronicles 20:11
text: behold, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of your possession, which you have given us to inherit.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:12
text: Our God, will you not judge them? For we have no might against this great company that comes against us; neither know we what to do, but our eyes are on you."

name: 2 Chronicles 20:13
text: All Judah stood before Yahweh, with their little ones, their wives, and their children.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:14
text: Then the Spirit of Yahweh came on Jahaziel the son of Zechariah, the son of Benaiah, the son of Jeiel, the son of Mattaniah, the Levite, of the sons of Asaph, in the midst of the assembly;

name: 2 Chronicles 20:15
text: and he said, "Listen, all Judah, and you inhabitants of Jerusalem, and you king Jehoshaphat. Thus says Yahweh to you, "Don"t be afraid, neither be dismayed by reason of this great multitude; for the battle is not yours, but God"s.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:16
text: Tomorrow go down against them. Behold, they are coming up by the ascent of Ziz. You shall find them at the end of the valley, before the wilderness of Jeruel.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:17
text: You will not need to fight this battle. Set yourselves, stand still, and see the salvation of Yahweh with you, O Judah and Jerusalem. Don"t be afraid, nor be dismayed. Go out against them tomorrow, for Yahweh is with you.""

name: 2 Chronicles 20:18
text: Jehoshaphat bowed his head with his face to the ground; and all Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem fell down before Yahweh, worshipping Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:19
text: The Levites, of the children of the Kohathites and of the children of the Korahites, stood up to praise Yahweh, the God of Israel, with an exceeding loud voice.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:20
text: They rose early in the morning, and went forth into the wilderness of Tekoa: and as they went forth, Jehoshaphat stood and said, "Listen to me, Judah, and you inhabitants of Jerusalem! Believe in Yahweh your God, so you shall be established! Believe his prophets, so you shall prosper."

name: 2 Chronicles 20:21
text: When he had taken counsel with the people, he appointed those who should sing to Yahweh, and give praise in holy array, as they went out before the army, and say, Give thanks to Yahweh; for his loving kindness endures forever.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:22
text: When they began to sing and to praise, Yahweh set ambushers against the children of Ammon, Moab, and Mount Seir, who had come against Judah; and they were struck.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:23
text: For the children of Ammon and Moab stood up against the inhabitants of Mount Seir, utterly to kill and destroy them: and when they had made an end of the inhabitants of Seir, everyone helped to destroy another.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:24
text: When Judah came to the place overlooking the wilderness, they looked at the multitude; and behold, they were dead bodies fallen to the earth, and there were none who escaped.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:25
text: When Jehoshaphat and his people came to take their spoil, they found among them in abundance both riches and dead bodies, and precious jewels, which they stripped off for themselves, more than they could carry away: and they were three days in taking the spoil, it was so much.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:26
text: On the fourth day they assembled themselves in the valley of Beracah; for there they blessed Yahweh: therefore the name of that place was called The valley of Beracah to this day.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:27
text: Then they returned, every man of Judah and Jerusalem, and Jehoshaphat in their forefront, to go again to Jerusalem with joy; for Yahweh had made them to rejoice over their enemies.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:28
text: They came to Jerusalem with stringed instruments and harps and trumpets to the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:29
text: The fear of God was on all the kingdoms of the countries, when they heard that Yahweh fought against the enemies of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:30
text: So the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet; for his God gave him rest all around.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:31
text: Jehoshaphat reigned over Judah: he was thirty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty-five years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Azubah the daughter of Shilhi.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:32
text: He walked in the way of Asa his father, and didn"t turn aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:33
text: However the high places were not taken away; neither as yet had the people set their hearts to the God of their fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:34
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoshaphat, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Jehu the son of Hanani, which is inserted in the book of the kings of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:35
text: After this Jehoshaphat king of Judah joined himself with Ahaziah king of Israel. The same did very wickedly:

name: 2 Chronicles 20:36
text: and he joined himself with him to make ships to go to Tarshish; and they made the ships in Ezion Geber.

name: 2 Chronicles 20:37
text: Then Eliezer the son of Dodavahu of Mareshah prophesied against Jehoshaphat, saying, "Because you have joined yourself with Ahaziah, Yahweh has destroyed your works." The ships were broken, so that they were not able to go to Tarshish.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:1
text: Jehoshaphat slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Jehoram his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:2
text: He had brothers, the sons of Jehoshaphat: Azariah, and Jehiel, and Zechariah, and Azariah, and Michael, and Shephatiah; all these were the sons of Jehoshaphat king of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:3
text: Their father gave them great gifts, of silver, and of gold, and of precious things, with fortified cities in Judah: but the kingdom gave he to Jehoram, because he was the firstborn.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:4
text: Now when Jehoram was risen up over the kingdom of his father, and had strengthened himself, he killed all his brothers with the sword, and various also of the princes of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:5
text: Jehoram was thirty-two years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eight years in Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:6
text: He walked in the way of the kings of Israel, as did the house of Ahab; for he had the daughter of Ahab as wife: and he did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:7
text: However Yahweh would not destroy the house of David, because of the covenant that he had made with David, and as he promised to give a lamp to him and to his children always.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:8
text: In his days Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah, and made a king over themselves.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:9
text: Then Jehoram passed over with his captains, and all his chariots with him: and he rose up by night, and struck the Edomites who surrounded him, along with the captains of the chariots.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:10
text: So Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah to this day: then Libnah revolted at the same time from under his hand, because he had forsaken Yahweh, the God of his fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:11
text: Moreover he made high places in the mountains of Judah, and made the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the prostitute, and led Judah astray.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:12
text: A letter came to him from Elijah the prophet, saying, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of David your father, "Because you have not walked in the ways of Jehoshaphat your father, nor in the ways of Asa king of Judah,

name: 2 Chronicles 21:13
text: but have walked in the way of the kings of Israel, and have made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to play the prostitute, like the house of Ahab did, and also have slain your brothers of your father"s house, who were better than yourself:

name: 2 Chronicles 21:14
text: behold, Yahweh will strike with a great plague your people, and your children, and your wives, and all your substance;

name: 2 Chronicles 21:15
text: and you shall have great sickness by disease of your bowels, until your bowels fall out by reason of the sickness, day by day.""

name: 2 Chronicles 21:16
text: Yahweh stirred up against Jehoram the spirit of the Philistines, and of the Arabians who are beside the Ethiopians:

name: 2 Chronicles 21:17
text: and they came up against Judah, and broke into it, and carried away all the substance that was found in the king"s house, and his sons also, and his wives; so that there was never a son left him, except Jehoahaz, the youngest of his sons.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:18
text: After all this Yahweh struck him in his bowels with an incurable disease.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:19
text: It happened, in process of time, at the end of two years, that his bowels fell out by reason of his sickness, and he died of severe diseases. His people made no burning for him, like the burning of his fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 21:20
text: Thirty-two years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years: and he departed without being desired; and they buried him in the city of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:1
text: The inhabitants of Jerusalem made Ahaziah his youngest son king in his place; for the band of men who came with the Arabians to the camp had slain all the eldest. So Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah reigned.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:2
text: Forty-two years old was Ahaziah when he began to reign; and he reigned one year in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Athaliah the daughter of Omri.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:3
text: He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab; for his mother was his counselor to do wickedly.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:4
text: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, as did the house of Ahab; for they were his counselors after the death of his father, to his destruction.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:5
text: He walked also after their counsel, and went with Jehoram the son of Ahab king of Israel to war against Hazael king of Syria at Ramoth Gilead: and the Syrians wounded Joram.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:6
text: He returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which they had given him at Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. Azariah the son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Jehoram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:7
text: Now the destruction of Ahaziah was of God, in that he went to Joram: for when he had come, he went out with Jehoram against Jehu the son of Nimshi, whom Yahweh had anointed to cut off the house of Ahab.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:8
text: It happened, when Jehu was executing judgment on the house of Ahab, that he found the princes of Judah, and the sons of the brothers of Ahaziah, ministering to Ahaziah, and killed them.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:9
text: He sought Ahaziah, and they caught him (now he was hiding in Samaria), and they brought him to Jehu, and killed him; and they buried him, for they said, "He is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought Yahweh with all his heart." The house of Ahaziah had no power to hold the kingdom.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:10
text: Now when Athaliah the mother of Ahaziah saw that her son was dead, she arose and destroyed all the royal seed of the house of Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:11
text: But Jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king, took Joash the son of Ahaziah, and stole him away from among the king"s sons who were slain, and put him and his nurse in the bedroom. So Jehoshabeath, the daughter of king Jehoram, the wife of Jehoiada the priest (for she was the sister of Ahaziah), hid him from Athaliah, so that she didn"t kill him.

name: 2 Chronicles 22:12
text: He was with them hidden in the house of God six years: and Athaliah reigned over the land.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:1
text: In the seventh year Jehoiada strengthened himself, and took the captains of hundreds, Azariah the son of Jeroham, and Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, and Azariah the son of Obed, and Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri, into covenant with him.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:2
text: They went about in Judah, and gathered the Levites out of all the cities of Judah, and the heads of fathers" households of Israel, and they came to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:3
text: All the assembly made a covenant with the king in the house of God. He said to them, "Behold, the king"s son shall reign, as Yahweh has spoken concerning the sons of David.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:4
text: This is the thing that you shall do. A third part of you, who come in on the Sabbath, of the priests and of the Levites, shall be porters of the thresholds.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:5
text: A third part shall be at the king"s house; and a third part at the gate of the foundation. All the people shall be in the courts of Yahweh"s house.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:6
text: But let no one come into the house of Yahweh, except the priests, and those who minister of the Levites. They shall come in, for they are holy, but all the people shall follow Yahweh"s instructions.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:7
text: The Levites shall surround the king, every man with his weapons in his hand. Whoever comes into the house, let him be slain. Be with the king when he comes in, and when he goes out."

name: 2 Chronicles 23:8
text: So the Levites and all Judah did according to all that Jehoiada the priest commanded: and they took every man his men, those who were to come in on the Sabbath; with those who were to go out on the Sabbath; for Jehoiada the priest didn"t dismiss the shift.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:9
text: Jehoiada the priest delivered to the captains of hundreds the spears, and bucklers, and shields, that had been king David"s, which were in the house of God.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:10
text: He set all the people, every man with his weapon in his hand, from the right side of the house to the left side of the house, along by the altar and the house, around the king.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:11
text: Then they brought out the king"s son, and put the crown on him, and gave him the testimony, and made him king: and Jehoiada and his sons anointed him; and they said, "Long live the king!"

name: 2 Chronicles 23:12
text: When Athaliah heard the noise of the people running and praising the king, she came to the people into the house of Yahweh:

name: 2 Chronicles 23:13
text: and she looked, and, behold, the king stood by his pillar at the entrance, and the captains and the trumpets by the king; and all the people of the land rejoiced, and blew trumpets; the singers also played musical instruments, and led the singing of praise. Then Athaliah tore her clothes, and said, "Treason! treason!"

name: 2 Chronicles 23:14
text: Jehoiada the priest brought out the captains of hundreds who were set over the army, and said to them, "Bring her out between the ranks; and whoever follows her, let him be slain with the sword." For the priest said, "Don"t kill her in the Yahweh"s house."

name: 2 Chronicles 23:15
text: So they made way for her. She went to the entrance of the horse gate to the king"s house; and they killed her there.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:16
text: Jehoiada made a covenant between himself, and all the people, and the king, that they should be Yahweh"s people.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:17
text: All the people went to the house of Baal, and broke it down, and broke his altars and his images in pieces, and killed Mattan the priest of Baal before the altars.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:18
text: Jehoiada appointed the officers of the house of Yahweh under the hand of the priests the Levites, whom David had distributed in the house of Yahweh, to offer the burnt offerings of Yahweh, as it is written in the law of Moses, with rejoicing and with singing, according to the order of David.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:19
text: He set the porters at the gates of the house of Yahweh, that no one who was unclean in anything should enter in.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:20
text: He took the captains of hundreds, and the nobles, and the governors of the people, and all the people of the land, and brought down the king from the house of Yahweh: and they came through the upper gate to the king"s house, and set the king on the throne of the kingdom.

name: 2 Chronicles 23:21
text: So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet. Athaliah they had slain with the sword.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:1
text: Joash was seven years old when he began to reign; and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Zibiah, of Beersheba.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:2
text: Joash did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh all the days of Jehoiada the priest.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:3
text: Jehoiada took for him two wives; and he became the father of sons and daughters.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:4
text: It happened after this, that Joash intended to restore the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:5
text: He gathered together the priests and the Levites, and said to them, "Go out to the cities of Judah, and gather money to repair the house of your God from all Israel from year to year. See that you expedite this matter." However the Levites didn"t do it right away.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:6
text: The king called for Jehoiada the chief, and said to him, "Why haven"t you required of the Levites to bring in the tax of Moses the servant of Yahweh, and of the assembly of Israel, out of Judah and out of Jerusalem, for the tent of the testimony?"

name: 2 Chronicles 24:7
text: For the sons of Athaliah, that wicked woman, had broken up the house of God; and they also gave all the dedicated things of the house of Yahweh to the Baals.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:8
text: So the king commanded, and they made a chest, and set it outside at the gate of the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:9
text: They made a proclamation through Judah and Jerusalem, to bring in for Yahweh the tax that Moses the servant of God laid on Israel in the wilderness.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:10
text: All the princes and all the people rejoiced, and brought in, and cast into the chest, until they had made an end.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:11
text: It was so, that whenever the chest was brought to the king"s officers by the hand of the Levites, and when they saw that there was much money, the king"s scribe and the chief priest"s officer came and emptied the chest, and took it, and carried it to its place again. Thus they did day by day, and gathered money in abundance.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:12
text: The king and Jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the service of the house of Yahweh; and they hired masons and carpenters to restore the house of Yahweh, and also such as worked iron and brass to repair the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:13
text: So the workmen worked, and the work of repairing went forward in their hands, and they set up the house of God in its state, and strengthened it.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:14
text: When they had made an end, they brought the rest of the money before the king and Jehoiada, of which were made vessels for the house of Yahweh, even vessels with which to minister and to offer, and spoons, and vessels of gold and silver. They offered burnt offerings in the house of Yahweh continually all the days of Jehoiada.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:15
text: But Jehoiada grew old and was full of days, and he died; one hundred thirty years old was he when he died.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:16
text: They buried him in the city of David among the kings, because he had done good in Israel, and toward God and his house.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:17
text: Now after the death of Jehoiada came the princes of Judah, and made obeisance to the king. Then the king listened to them.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:18
text: They forsook the house of Yahweh, the God of their fathers, and served the Asherim and the idols: and wrath came on Judah and Jerusalem for this their guiltiness.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:19
text: Yet he sent prophets to them, to bring them again to Yahweh; and they testified against them: but they would not give ear.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:20
text: The Spirit of God came on Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest; and he stood above the people, and said to them, "Thus says God, "Why do you disobey the commandments of Yahweh, so that you can"t prosper? Because you have forsaken Yahweh, he has also forsaken you.""

name: 2 Chronicles 24:21
text: They conspired against him, and stoned him with stones at the commandment of the king in the court of the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:22
text: Thus Joash the king didn"t remember the kindness which Jehoiada his father had done to him, but killed his son. When he died, he said, "May Yahweh look at it, and repay it."

name: 2 Chronicles 24:23
text: It happened at the end of the year, that the army of the Syrians came up against him: and they came to Judah and Jerusalem, and destroyed all the princes of the people from among the people, and sent all their spoil to the king of Damascus.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:24
text: For the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men; and Yahweh delivered a very great army into their hand, because they had forsaken Yahweh, the God of their fathers. So they executed judgment on Joash.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:25
text: When they were departed for him (for they left him very sick), his own servants conspired against him for the blood of the sons of Jehoiada the priest, and killed him on his bed, and he died; and they buried him in the city of David, but they didn"t bury him in the tombs of the kings.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:26
text: These are those who conspired against him: Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonitess, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabitess.

name: 2 Chronicles 24:27
text: Now concerning his sons, and the greatness of the burdens laid on him, and the rebuilding of the house of God, behold, they are written in the commentary of the book of the kings. Amaziah his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:1
text: Amaziah was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Jehoaddan, of Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:2
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, but not with a perfect heart.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:3
text: Now it happened, when the kingdom was established to him, that he killed his servants who had killed the king his father.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:4
text: But he didn"t put their children to death, but did according to that which is written in the law in the book of Moses, as Yahweh commanded, saying, "The fathers shall not die for the children, neither shall the children die for the fathers; but every man shall die for his own sin."

name: 2 Chronicles 25:5
text: Moreover Amaziah gathered Judah together, and ordered them according to their fathers" houses, under captains of thousands and captains of hundreds, even all Judah and Benjamin: and he numbered them from twenty years old and upward, and found them three hundred thousand chosen men, able to go forth to war, who could handle spear and shield.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:6
text: He hired also one hundred thousand mighty men of valor out of Israel for one hundred talents of silver.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:7
text: A man of God came to him, saying, "O king, don"t let the army of Israel go with you; for Yahweh is not with Israel, with all the children of Ephraim.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:8
text: But if you will go, take action, be strong for the battle. God will overthrow you before the enemy; for God has power to help, and to overthrow."

name: 2 Chronicles 25:9
text: Amaziah said to the man of God, "But what shall we do for the hundred talents which I have given to the army of Israel?" The man of God answered, "Yahweh is able to give you much more than this."

name: 2 Chronicles 25:10
text: Then Amaziah separated them, the army that had come to him out of Ephraim, to go home again: therefore their anger was greatly kindled against Judah, and they returned home in fierce anger.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:11
text: Amaziah took courage, and led forth his people, and went to the Valley of Salt, and struck ten thousand of the children of Seir.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:12
text: The children of Judah carry away ten thousand alive, and brought them to the top of the rock, and threw them down from the top of the rock, so that they all were broken in pieces.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:13
text: But the men of the army whom Amaziah sent back, that they should not go with him to battle, fell on the cities of Judah, from Samaria even to Beth Horon, and struck of them three thousand, and took much spoil.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:14
text: Now it happened, after that Amaziah had come from the slaughter of the Edomites, that he brought the gods of the children of Seir, and set them up to be his gods, and bowed down himself before them, and burned incense to them.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:15
text: Therefore the anger of Yahweh was kindled against Amaziah, and he sent to him a prophet, who said to him, "Why have you sought after the gods of the people, which have not delivered their own people out of your hand?"

name: 2 Chronicles 25:16
text: It happened, as he talked with him, that the king said to him, "Have we made you one of the king"s counselors? Stop! Why should you be struck down?" Then the prophet stopped, and said, "I know that God has determined to destroy you, because you have done this, and have not listened to my counsel."

name: 2 Chronicles 25:17
text: Then Amaziah king of Judah consulted his advisers, and sent to Joash, the son of Jehoahaz the son of Jehu, king of Israel, saying, "Come, let us look one another in the face."

name: 2 Chronicles 25:18
text: Joash king of Israel sent to Amaziah king of Judah, saying, "The thistle that was in Lebanon sent to the cedar that was in Lebanon, saying, "Give your daughter to my son as his wife; then a wild animal that was in Lebanon passed by, and trampled down the thistle.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:19
text: You say to yourself that you have struck Edom; and your heart lifts you up to boast. Now stay at home. Why should you meddle with trouble, that you should fall, even you, and Judah with you?""

name: 2 Chronicles 25:20
text: But Amaziah would not listen; for it was of God, that he might deliver them into the hand of their enemies, because they had sought after the gods of Edom.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:21
text: So Joash king of Israel went up; and he and Amaziah king of Judah looked one another in the face at Beth Shemesh, which belongs to Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:22
text: Judah was defeated by Israel; and they fled every man to his tent.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:23
text: Joash king of Israel took Amaziah king of Judah, the son of Joash the son of Jehoahaz, at Beth Shemesh, and brought him to Jerusalem, and broke down the wall of Jerusalem from the gate of Ephraim to the corner gate, four hundred cubits.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:24
text: He took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that were found in the house of God with Obed-Edom, and the treasures of the king"s house, the hostages also, and returned to Samaria.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:25
text: Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah lived after the death of Joash son of Jehoahaz king of Israel fifteen years.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:26
text: Now the rest of the acts of Amaziah, first and last, behold, aren"t they written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel?

name: 2 Chronicles 25:27
text: Now from the time that Amaziah turned away from following Yahweh, they made a conspiracy against him in Jerusalem. He fled to Lachish; but they sent after him to Lachish, and killed him there.

name: 2 Chronicles 25:28
text: They brought him on horses, and buried him with his fathers in the city of Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:1
text: All the people of Judah took Uzziah, who was sixteen years old, and made him king in the place of his father Amaziah.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:2
text: He built Eloth, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:3
text: Sixteen years old was Uzziah when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Jechiliah, of Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:4
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:5
text: He set himself to seek God in the days of Zechariah, who had understanding in the vision of God: and as long as he sought Yahweh, God made him to prosper.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:6
text: He went forth and warred against the Philistines, and broke down the wall of Gath, and the wall of Jabneh, and the wall of Ashdod; and he built cities in the country of Ashdod, and among the Philistines.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:7
text: God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians who lived in Gur Baal, and the Meunim.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:8
text: The Ammonites gave tribute to Uzziah: and his name spread abroad even to the entrance of Egypt; for he grew exceeding strong.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:9
text: Moreover Uzziah built towers in Jerusalem at the corner gate, and at the valley gate, and at the turning of the wall, and fortified them.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:10
text: He built towers in the wilderness, and dug out many cisterns, for he had much livestock; in the lowland also, and in the plain: and he had farmers and vineyard keepers in the mountains and in the fruitful fields; for he loved farming.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:11
text: Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting men, who went out to war by bands, according to the number of their reckoning made by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king"s captains.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:12
text: The whole number of the heads of fathers" households, even the mighty men of valor, was two thousand and six hundred.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:13
text: Under their hand was an army, three hundred thousand and seven thousand and five hundred, who made war with mighty power, to help the king against the enemy.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:14
text: Uzziah prepared for them, even for all the army, shields, and spears, and helmets, and coats of mail, and bows, and stones for slinging.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:15
text: He made in Jerusalem engines, invented by skillful men, to be on the towers and on the battlements, with which to shoot arrows and great stones. His name spread far abroad; for he was marvelously helped, until he was strong.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:16
text: But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up, so that he did corruptly, and he trespassed against Yahweh his God; for he went into the temple of Yahweh to burn incense on the altar of incense.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:17
text: Azariah the priest went in after him, and with him eighty priests of Yahweh, who were valiant men:

name: 2 Chronicles 26:18
text: and they resisted Uzziah the king, and said to him, "It isn"t for you, Uzziah, to burn incense to Yahweh, but for the priests the sons of Aaron, who are consecrated to burn incense. Go out of the sanctuary; for you have trespassed; neither shall it be for your honor from Yahweh God."

name: 2 Chronicles 26:19
text: Then Uzziah was angry; and he had a censer in his hand to burn incense; and while he was angry with the priests, the leprosy broke forth in his forehead before the priests in the house of Yahweh, beside the altar of incense.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:20
text: Azariah the chief priest, and all the priests, looked on him, and behold, he was leprous in his forehead, and they thrust him out quickly from there; yes, himself hurried also to go out, because Yahweh had struck him.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:21
text: Uzziah the king was a leper to the day of his death, and lived in a separate house, being a leper; for he was cut off from the house of Yahweh: and Jotham his son was over the king"s house, judging the people of the land.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:22
text: Now the rest of the acts of Uzziah, first and last, Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, wrote.

name: 2 Chronicles 26:23
text: So Uzziah slept with his fathers; and they buried him with his fathers in the field of burial which belonged to the kings; for they said, "He is a leper." Jotham his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:1
text: Jotham was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Jerushah the daughter of Zadok.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:2
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, according to all that his father Uzziah had done: however he didn"t enter into the temple of Yahweh. The people still did corruptly.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:3
text: He built the upper gate of the house of Yahweh, and on the wall of Ophel he built much.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:4
text: Moreover he built cities in the hill country of Judah, and in the forests he built castles and towers.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:5
text: He fought also with the king of the children of Ammon, and prevailed against them. The children of Ammon gave him the same year one hundred talents of silver, and ten thousand measures of wheat, and ten thousand of barley. The children of Ammon gave that much to him in the second year also, and in the third.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:6
text: So Jotham became mighty, because he ordered his ways before Yahweh his God.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:7
text: Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all his wars, and his ways, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:8
text: He was five and twenty years old when he began to reign, and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 27:9
text: Jotham slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David: and Ahaz his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:1
text: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign; and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem: and he didn"t do that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, like David his father;

name: 2 Chronicles 28:2
text: but he walked in the ways of the kings of Israel, and made also molten images for the Baals.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:3
text: Moreover he burnt incense in the valley of the son of Hinnom, and burnt his children in the fire, according to the abominations of the nations whom Yahweh cast out before the children of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:4
text: He sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:5
text: Therefore Yahweh his God delivered him into the hand of the king of Syria; and they struck him, and carried away of his a great multitude of captives, and brought them to Damascus. He was also delivered into the hand of the king of Israel, who struck him with a great slaughter.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:6
text: For Pekah the son of Remaliah killed in Judah one hundred twenty thousand in one day, all of them valiant men; because they had forsaken Yahweh, the God of their fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:7
text: Zichri, a mighty man of Ephraim, killed Maaseiah the king"s son, and Azrikam the ruler of the house, and Elkanah who was next to the king.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:8
text: The children of Israel carried away captive of their brothers two hundred thousand, women, sons, and daughters, and took also away much spoil from them, and brought the spoil to Samaria.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:9
text: But a prophet of Yahweh was there, whose name was Oded: and he went out to meet the army that came to Samaria, and said to them, "Behold, because Yahweh, the God of your fathers, was angry with Judah, he has delivered them into your hand, and you have slain them in a rage which has reached up to heaven.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:10
text: Now you purpose to keep under the children of Judah and Jerusalem for bondservants and bondmaids for yourselves. Aren"t there even with you trespasses of your own against Yahweh your God?

name: 2 Chronicles 28:11
text: Now hear me therefore, and send back the captives, that you have taken captive from your brothers; for the fierce wrath of Yahweh is on you."

name: 2 Chronicles 28:12
text: Then some of the heads of the children of Ephraim, Azariah the son of Johanan, Berechiah the son of Meshillemoth, and Jehizkiah the son of Shallum, and Amasa the son of Hadlai, stood up against those who came from the war,

name: 2 Chronicles 28:13
text: and said to them, "You shall not bring in the captives here: for you purpose that which will bring on us a trespass against Yahweh, to add to our sins and to our trespass; for our trespass is great, and there is fierce wrath against Israel."

name: 2 Chronicles 28:14
text: So the armed men left the captives and the spoil before the princes and all the assembly.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:15
text: The men who have been mentioned by name rose up, and took the captives, and with the spoil clothed all who were naked among them, dressed them, gave them sandals, and gave them something to eat and to drink, anointed them, carried all the feeble of them on donkeys, and brought them to Jericho, the city of palm trees, to their brothers. Then they returned to Samaria.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:16
text: At that time king Ahaz sent to the kings of Assyria to help him.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:17
text: For again the Edomites had come and struck Judah, and carried away captives.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:18
text: The Philistines also had invaded the cities of the lowland, and of the South of Judah, and had taken Beth Shemesh, and Aijalon, and Gederoth, and Soco with its towns, and Timnah with its towns, Gimzo also and its towns: and they lived there.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:19
text: For Yahweh brought Judah low because of Ahaz king of Israel; for he had dealt wantonly in Judah, and trespassed severely against Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:20
text: Tilgath Pilneser king of Assyria came to him, and distressed him, but didn"t strengthen him.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:21
text: For Ahaz took away a portion out of the house of Yahweh, and out of the house of the king and of the princes, and gave it to the king of Assyria: but it didn"t help him.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:22
text: In the time of his distress, he trespassed yet more against Yahweh, this same king Ahaz.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:23
text: For he sacrificed to the gods of Damascus, which struck him; and he said, "Because the gods of the kings of Syria helped them, so I will sacrifice to them, that they may help me." But they were the ruin of him, and of all Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:24
text: Ahaz gathered together the vessels of the house of God, and cut in pieces the vessels of the house of God, and shut up the doors of the house of Yahweh; and he made him altars in every corner of Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:25
text: In every city of Judah he made high places to burn incense to other gods, and provoked to anger Yahweh, the God of his fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:26
text: Now the rest of his acts, and all his ways, first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Judah and Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 28:27
text: Ahaz slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city, even in Jerusalem; for they didn"t bring him into the tombs of the kings of Israel: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his place.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:1
text: Hezekiah began to reign when he was twenty-five years old; and he reigned twenty-nine years in Jerusalem: and his mother"s name was Abijah, the daughter of Zechariah.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:2
text: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, according to all that David his father had done.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:3
text: He in the first year of his reign, in the first month, opened the doors of the house of Yahweh, and repaired them.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:4
text: He brought in the priests and the Levites, and gathered them together into the broad place on the east,

name: 2 Chronicles 29:5
text: and said to them, "Listen to me, you Levites! Now sanctify yourselves, and sanctify the house of Yahweh, the God of your fathers, and carry out the filthiness out of the holy place.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:6
text: For our fathers have trespassed, and done that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh our God, and have forsaken him, and have turned away their faces from the habitation of Yahweh, and turned their backs.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:7
text: Also they have shut up the doors of the porch, and put out the lamps, and have not burned incense nor offered burnt offerings in the holy place to the God of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:8
text: Therefore the wrath of Yahweh was on Judah and Jerusalem, and he has delivered them to be tossed back and forth, to be an astonishment, and a hissing, as you see with your eyes.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:9
text: For, behold, our fathers have fallen by the sword, and our sons and our daughters and our wives are in captivity for this.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:10
text: Now it is in my heart to make a covenant with Yahweh, the God of Israel, that his fierce anger may turn away from us.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:11
text: My sons, don"t be negligent now; for Yahweh has chosen you to stand before him, to minister to him, and that you should be his ministers, and burn incense."

name: 2 Chronicles 29:12
text: Then the Levites arose, Mahath, the son of Amasai, and Joel the son of Azariah, of the sons of the Kohathites; and of the sons of Merari, Kish the son of Abdi, and Azariah the son of Jehallelel; and of the Gershonites, Joah the son of Zimmah, and Eden the son of Joah;

name: 2 Chronicles 29:13
text: and of the sons of Elizaphan, Shimri and Jeuel; and of the sons of Asaph, Zechariah and Mattaniah;

name: 2 Chronicles 29:14
text: and of the sons of Heman, Jehuel and Shimei; and of the sons of Jeduthun, Shemaiah and Uzziel.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:15
text: They gathered their brothers, and sanctified themselves, and went in, according to the commandment of the king by the words of Yahweh, to cleanse the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:16
text: The priests went in to the inner part of the house of Yahweh, to cleanse it, and brought out all the uncleanness that they found in the temple of Yahweh into the court of the house of Yahweh. The Levites took it, to carry it out abroad to the brook Kidron.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:17
text: Now they began on the first day of the first month to sanctify, and on the eighth day of the month came they to the porch of Yahweh; and they sanctified the house of Yahweh in eight days: and on the sixteenth day of the first month they made an end.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:18
text: Then they went in to Hezekiah the king within the palace, and said, "We have cleansed all the house of Yahweh, and the altar of burnt offering, with all its vessels, and the table of show bread, with all its vessels.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:19
text: Moreover all the vessels, which king Ahaz in his reign threw away when he trespassed, have we prepared and sanctified; and behold, they are before the altar of Yahweh."

name: 2 Chronicles 29:20
text: Then Hezekiah the king arose early, and gathered the princes of the city, and went up to the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:21
text: They brought seven bulls, and seven rams, and seven lambs, and seven male goats, for a sin offering for the kingdom and for the sanctuary and for Judah. He commanded the priests the sons of Aaron to offer them on the altar of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:22
text: So they killed the bulls, and the priests received the blood, and sprinkled it on the altar: and they killed the rams, and sprinkled the blood on the altar: they killed also the lambs, and sprinkled the blood on the altar.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:23
text: They brought near the male goats for the sin offering before the king and the assembly; and they laid their hands on them:

name: 2 Chronicles 29:24
text: and the priests killed them, and they made a sin offering with their blood on the altar, to make atonement for all Israel; for the king commanded that the burnt offering and the sin offering should be made for all Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:25
text: He set the Levites in the house of Yahweh with cymbals, with stringed instruments, and with harps, according to the commandment of David, and of Gad the king"s seer, and Nathan the prophet; for the commandment was of Yahweh by his prophets.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:26
text: The Levites stood with the instruments of David, and the priests with the trumpets.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:27
text: Hezekiah commanded to offer the burnt offering on the altar. When the burnt offering began, the song of Yahweh began also, and the trumpets, together with the instruments of David king of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:28
text: All the assembly worshiped, and the singers sang, and the trumpeters sounded; all this continued until the burnt offering was finished.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:29
text: When they had made an end of offering, the king and all who were present with him bowed themselves and worshiped.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:30
text: Moreover Hezekiah the king and the princes commanded the Levites to sing praises to Yahweh with the words of David, and of Asaph the seer. They sang praises with gladness, and they bowed their heads and worshiped.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:31
text: Then Hezekiah answered, "Now you have consecrated yourselves to Yahweh; come near and bring sacrifices and thank offerings into the house of Yahweh." The assembly brought in sacrifices and thank offerings; and as many as were of a willing heart brought burnt offerings.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:32
text: The number of the burnt offerings which the assembly brought was seventy bulls, one hundred rams, and two hundred lambs: all these were for a burnt offering to Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:33
text: The consecrated things were six hundred head of cattle and three thousand sheep.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:34
text: But the priests were too few, so that they could not flay all the burnt offerings: therefore their brothers the Levites helped them, until the work was ended, and until the priests had sanctified themselves; for the Levites were more upright in heart to sanctify themselves than the priests.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:35
text: Also the burnt offerings were in abundance, with the fat of the peace offerings, and with the drink offerings for every burnt offering. So the service of the house of Yahweh was set in order.

name: 2 Chronicles 29:36
text: Hezekiah rejoiced, and all the people, because of that which God had prepared for the people: for the thing was done suddenly.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:1
text: Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of Yahweh at Jerusalem, to keep the Passover to Yahweh, the God of Israel.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:2
text: For the king had taken counsel, and his princes, and all the assembly in Jerusalem, to keep the Passover in the second month.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:3
text: For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves in sufficient number, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:4
text: The thing was right in the eyes of the king and of all the assembly.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:5
text: So they established a decree to make proclamation throughout all Israel, from Beersheba even to Dan, that they should come to keep the Passover to Yahweh, the God of Israel, at Jerusalem: for they had not kept it in great numbers in such sort as it is written.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:6
text: So the couriers went with the letters from the king and his princes throughout all Israel and Judah, and according to the commandment of the king, saying, "You children of Israel, turn again to Yahweh, the God of Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, that he may return to the remnant that have escaped of you out of the hand of the kings of Assyria.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:7
text: Don"t be like your fathers, and like your brothers, who trespassed against Yahweh, the God of their fathers, so that he gave them up to desolation, as you see.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:8
text: Now don"t be stiff-necked, as your fathers were; but yield yourselves to Yahweh, and enter into his sanctuary, which he has sanctified forever, and serve Yahweh your God, that his fierce anger may turn away from you.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:9
text: For if you turn again to Yahweh, your brothers and your children shall find compassion before those who led them captive, and shall come again into this land: for Yahweh your God is gracious and merciful, and will not turn away his face from you, if you return to him."

name: 2 Chronicles 30:10
text: So the couriers passed from city to city through the country of Ephraim and Manasseh, even to Zebulun: but they ridiculed them, and mocked them.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:11
text: Nevertheless certain men of Asher and Manasseh and of Zebulun humbled themselves, and came to Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:12
text: Also on Judah came the hand of God to give them one heart, to do the commandment of the king and of the princes by the word of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:13
text: Many people assembled at Jerusalem to keep the feast of unleavened bread in the second month, a very great assembly.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:14
text: They arose and took away the altars that were in Jerusalem, and all the altars for incense took they away, and cast them into the brook Kidron.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:15
text: Then they killed the Passover on the fourteenth day of the second month: and the priests and the Levites were ashamed, and sanctified themselves, and brought burnt offerings into the house of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:16
text: They stood in their place after their order, according to the law of Moses the man of God: the priests sprinkled the blood which they received of the hand of the Levites.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:17
text: For there were many in the assembly who had not sanctified themselves: therefore the Levites were in charge of killing the Passovers for everyone who was not clean, to sanctify them to Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:18
text: For a multitude of the people, even many of Ephraim and Manasseh, Issachar and Zebulun, had not cleansed themselves, yet they ate the Passover otherwise than it is written. For Hezekiah had prayed for them, saying, "May the good Yahweh pardon everyone

name: 2 Chronicles 30:19
text: who sets his heart to seek God, Yahweh, the God of his fathers, even if they aren"t clean according to the purification of the sanctuary."

name: 2 Chronicles 30:20
text: Yahweh listened to Hezekiah, and healed the people.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:21
text: The children of Israel who were present at Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with great gladness; and the Levites and the priests praised Yahweh day by day, singing with loud instruments to Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:22
text: Hezekiah spoke comfortably to all the Levites who had good understanding in the service of Yahweh. So they ate throughout the feast for the seven days, offering sacrifices of peace offerings, and making confession to Yahweh, the God of their fathers.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:23
text: The whole assembly took counsel to keep other seven days; and they kept another seven days with gladness.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:24
text: For Hezekiah king of Judah gave to the assembly for offerings one thousand bulls and seven thousand sheep; and the princes gave to the assembly a thousand bulls and ten thousand sheep: and a great number of priests sanctified themselves.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:25
text: All the assembly of Judah, with the priests and the Levites, and all the assembly who came out of Israel, and the foreigners who came out of the land of Israel, and who lived in Judah, rejoiced.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:26
text: So there was great joy in Jerusalem; for since the time of Solomon the son of David king of Israel there was not the like in Jerusalem.

name: 2 Chronicles 30:27
text: Then the priests the Levites arose and blessed the people: and their voice was heard, and their prayer came up to his holy habitation, even to heaven.

name: 2 Chronicles 31:1
text: Now when all this was finished, all Israel who were present went out to the cities of Judah, and broke in pieces the pillars, and cut down the Asherim, and broke down the high places and the altars out of all Judah and Benjamin, in Ephraim also and Manasseh, until they had destroyed them all. Then all the children of Israel returned, every man to his possession, into their own cities.

name: 2 Chronicles 31:2
text: Hezekiah appointed the divisions of the priests and the Levites after their divisions, every man according to his service, both the priests and the Levites, for burnt offerings and for peace offerings, to minister, and to give thanks, and to praise in the gates of the camp of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 31:3
text: He appointed also the king"s portion of his substance for the burnt offerings, for the morning and evening burnt offerings, and the burnt offerings for the Sabbaths, and for the new moons, and for the set feasts, as it is written in the law of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 31:4
text: Moreover he commanded the people who lived in Jerusalem to give the portion of the priests and the Levites, that they might give themselves to the law of Yahweh.

name: 2 Chronicles 31:5
text: As soon as the commandment came abroad, the children of Israel gave in abundance the first fruits of grain, new wine, and oil, and honey, and of all the increase of the field; and the tithe of all things brought they in abundantly.

name: 2 Chronicles 31:6
text: The children of Israel and Judah, who lived in the cities of Judah, they also brought in the tithe of cattle and sheep, and the tithe of dedicated things which were consecrated to Yahweh their God, and laid them by heaps.

name: 2 Chronicles 31:7
text: In the third month they began to lay the foundation of the heaps, and finished them in the seventh month.

name: 2 Chronicles 31:8
